page.title: 03Local History in Brafferton
page.content:
The area around Brafferton is an area well established with a long history.Recently discovered is the {Medieval Village}of Coatham Mundeville which was examined by people from Newcastle University. Near by are two ancient monuments, a church which has been converted into a house and a farm, part of Coatham Hall Farm, which is being modernised. Near to the railway line by Hill Banks is the site of an{Anglo-Saxon settlement.}
Close by are Ketton Hall, which was a monastry,and Ketton Bridge which was a pack horse route for{salt.}Farmers have found pottery in the area from the Carthusian monastry which was part of Durham Priory. Within this area too, is Peartree House which is actually mentioned in the{Domesday} {Book.}
